text: Love their ABC soup. Available on Thursday  and Friday. The potato is like dissolved into the broth. And the ingredients are generous. It‚Äôs the best ABC Soup that I‚Äôve eaten so far.

A soup gem hidden in the enclaves of industrial park with moderately heavy machinery and a lot of motor shop that don‚Äôt knw do what.
Fav soup, chicken and Buddha. Really good and hearbie feel. Generous on rice and soup and meat and condiments. üç≤ üç≤ üç≤.

Hidden gem indeed! Super delicious and tasty soup with lots of ingredients.
The best soup I had in Singapore! Lady and gentlemen boss are very friendly and courteous too. Highly recommended! My personal favorite got to be ÂçÅÂÖ® chicken soup and  peanut lotus soup. I had 3 more soups to take away as it was really good.

Their Pork Rib Lotus Soup was thick, with the pork ribs being soft and tender. There was little to no cuttlefish, which I liked. Overall, it was a surprising find, and the food quality exceeded expectations.

(1) Buddha jump over wall soup - Fantastic thick soup, came with lots of ingredients! A plump chicken thigh, fish maw rings, abalone slices, juicy QQ mushroom slices, & ard 5-6 pieces of dried oysters. (2) Yam rice was of generous portion - authentic old-school type, with big cubes of Yam, rice was fluffy & well-flavored! Very good value for money. Amazing flavors done just right, super earnest service by the lady stallholder, even offered free soup refills. Wed evening ~630pm, not crowded, weather was cooling off so overall dining atmosphere was acceptable. Tables are well spaced out & ceiling fans aplenty. Able to get parking lot quite easily. Didn't take pic of the soup, only the Yam rice. Will surely be back.
